page.title: 08Memories of Whaddon.
page.content: The Domesday Book records that Wedvne was held by 5 brothers as co-heirs and they could go where they pleased. The name means "hill where wheat is grown". Mr. Brunt was born in 1908 and has lived all his life in Whaddon. His young interviewer learned this: The Manor House was then empty but its new owner arrived by horse and carriage in 1909. In 1939 the Manor became Wynstones School. Dutch elm disease caused the 250 year old elm trees around the green to be cut down a few years ago. The only shop in the village was the Post Office stores. It does not have even that now. Electricity came to Whaddon only in 1951, just after the arrival of mains water. The village pump still stands. The old "Bull" pub is now called "Tillstones", a house.
